title: Deciding parity games in quasipolynomial time.
abstract: It is shown that the parity game can be solved in quasipolynomial time. The parameterised parity game â   with  n  nodes and  m  distinct values (aka colours or priorities) â   is proven to be in the class of fixed parameter tractable ( FPT ) problems when parameterised over  m . Both results improve known bounds, from runtime  n   O (â   n )  to  O ( n  log( m )+6 ) and from an  XP -algorithm with runtime  O ( n  I ( m ) ) for fixed parameter  m  to an  FPT -algorithm with runtime  O ( n  5 )+ g ( m ), for some function  g  depending on  m  only. As an application it is proven that coloured Muller games with  n  nodes and  m  colours can be decided in time  O (( m   m   �·  n ) 5 ); it is also shown that this bound cannot be improved to  O ((2  m   �·  n )  c  ), for any  c , unless  FPT  =  W[1] .
